question_text: In Warpspace, identity echoes form when citizens with similar names hide across regions. Zero must find citizens whose name prefix matches another citizen in a different region, but only among structurally valid identities.
question_hint: String logic combined with deep joins.
question_answer: SELECT DISTINCT c.name FROM citizens c JOIN addresses a ON c.address_id = a.id JOIN zones z ON a.zone_id = z.id JOIN regions r ON z.region_id = r.id JOIN factions f ON c.faction_id = f.id JOIN roles ro ON c.role_id = ro.id JOIN identity_logs il ON il.citizen_id = c.id WHERE c.is_corrupted = 0 AND EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM citizens c2 JOIN addresses a2 ON c2.address_id = a2.id JOIN zones z2 ON a2.zone_id = z2.id WHERE SUBSTRING(c.name,1,3) = SUBSTRING(c2.name,1,3) AND z2.region_id <> r.id);

question_text: Pixel discovers that some regions only appear stable because the second highest transaction hides the real collapse. Zero must identify regions whose second highest merchant revenue exceeds safe limits.
question_answer: SELECT r.region_name FROM regions r WHERE (SELECT MAX(total_rev) FROM (SELECT SUM(t.amount) AS total_rev FROM merchants m JOIN transactions t ON m.id = t.merchant_id WHERE m.region_id = r.id GROUP BY m.id HAVING SUM(t.amount) < (SELECT MAX(SUM(t2.amount)) FROM merchants m2 JOIN transactions t2 ON m2.id = t2.merchant_id WHERE m2.region_id = r.id GROUP BY m2.id)) x) > 500000;

question_text: Nyx orders Zero to find citizens whose third lowest transaction amount is higher than the average transaction of their entire faction.
question_answer: SELECT c.name FROM citizens c WHERE (SELECT MIN(t.amount) FROM transactions t WHERE t.citizen_id = c.id AND t.amount > (SELECT MIN(t2.amount) FROM transactions t2 WHERE t2.citizen_id = c.id AND t2.amount > (SELECT MIN(t3.amount) FROM transactions t3 WHERE t3.citizen_id = c.id))) > (SELECT AVG(t4.amount) FROM transactions t4 JOIN citizens c4 ON t4.citizen_id = c4.id WHERE c4.faction_id = c.faction_id);

question_text: Warpspace fractures when roles leak across regions. Zero must identify roles whose citizens span more than two regions and whose role name contains encoded prefixes.
question_answer: SELECT ro.role_name FROM roles ro JOIN citizens c ON ro.id = c.role_id JOIN addresses a ON c.address_id = a.id JOIN zones z ON a.zone_id = z.id JOIN regions r ON z.region_id = r.id GROUP BY ro.role_name HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT r.id) > 2 AND ro.role_name LIKE 'X_%';

question_text: Some factions manipulate identity logs by reusing addresses with similar street names. Zero must identify factions where two different zones share addresses with matching street suffixes.
question_answer: SELECT DISTINCT f.faction_name FROM factions f JOIN citizens c ON f.id = c.faction_id JOIN addresses a ON c.address_id = a.id JOIN zones z ON a.zone_id = z.id WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM addresses a2 JOIN zones z2 ON a2.zone_id = z2.id WHERE z2.id <> z.id AND RIGHT(a.street_name,4) = RIGHT(a2.street_name,4));

question_text: Nyx suspects artificial inflation where a citizen’s highest transaction is masking two extremely low ones. Zero must identify citizens whose highest transaction is at least five times their second lowest.
question_answer: SELECT c.name FROM citizens c WHERE (SELECT MAX(t.amount) FROM transactions t WHERE t.citizen_id = c.id) >= 5 * (SELECT MIN(t2.amount) FROM transactions t2 WHERE t2.citizen_id = c.id AND t2.amount > (SELECT MIN(t3.amount) FROM transactions t3 WHERE t3.citizen_id = c.id));

question_text: Pixel detects temporal corruption where citizens with similar email domains appear across unstable regions. Zero must identify such citizens.
question_answer: SELECT DISTINCT c.name FROM citizens c JOIN addresses a ON c.address_id = a.id JOIN zones z ON a.zone_id = z.id JOIN regions r ON z.region_id = r.id WHERE r.stability_score < 50 AND SUBSTRING_INDEX(c.email,'@',-1) IN (SELECT SUBSTRING_INDEX(c2.email,'@',-1) FROM citizens c2 JOIN addresses a2 ON c2.address_id = a2.id JOIN zones z2 ON a2.zone_id = z2.id JOIN regions r2 ON z2.region_id = r2.id WHERE r2.id <> r.id);

question_text: Warpspace hides collapse by distributing low-level corruption evenly. Zero must identify regions whose third highest citizen threat exceeds the global second highest threat.
question_answer: SELECT r.region_name FROM regions r WHERE (SELECT MAX(c.threat_level) FROM citizens c JOIN addresses a ON c.address_id = a.id JOIN zones z ON a.zone_id = z.id WHERE z.region_id = r.id AND c.threat_level < (SELECT MAX(threat_level) FROM citizens WHERE threat_level < (SELECT MAX(threat_level) FROM citizens))) > (SELECT MAX(threat_level) FROM citizens WHERE threat_level < (SELECT MAX(threat_level) FROM citizens));

question_text: Nyx orders a stability audit to find citizens whose name patterns and transaction patterns match known collapse signatures.
question_answer: SELECT c.name FROM citizens c WHERE c.name REGEXP '^[A-Z]{2}[0-9]+' AND (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM transactions t WHERE t.citizen_id = c.id AND t.amount < 10) >= 3;

question_text: Zero must isolate citizens who appear structurally valid but whose addresses, roles, factions, and regions form a dependency loop.
question_answer: SELECT c.name FROM citizens c JOIN roles ro ON c.role_id = ro.id JOIN factions f ON c.faction_id = f.id JOIN addresses a ON c.address_id = a.id JOIN zones z ON a.zone_id = z.id JOIN regions r ON z.region_id = r.id WHERE ro.faction_id <> f.id OR f.region_id <> r.id;

question_text: BOSS FIGHT: The Recursion Entity fractures Warpspace by hiding corruption in ranked extremes. To weaken it, Zero must find factions where the second highest regional revenue exceeds the third lowest global faction revenue, excluding all corrupted citizens.
question_answer: SELECT f.faction_name FROM factions f WHERE (SELECT MAX(region_rev) FROM (SELECT SUM(t.amount) AS region_rev FROM citizens c JOIN addresses a ON c.address_id = a.id JOIN zones z ON a.zone_id = z.id JOIN regions r ON z.region_id = r.id JOIN transactions t ON c.id = t.citizen_id WHERE c.faction_id = f.id AND c.is_corrupted = 0 GROUP BY r.id HAVING SUM(t.amount) < (SELECT MAX(SUM(t2.amount)) FROM citizens c2 JOIN transactions t2 ON c2.id = t2.citizen_id WHERE c2.faction_id = f.id GROUP BY r.id)) x) > (SELECT MIN(faction_rev) FROM (SELECT SUM(t3.amount) AS faction_rev FROM citizens c3 JOIN transactions t3 ON c3.id = t3.citizen_id GROUP BY c3.faction_id ORDER BY faction_rev LIMIT 3) y);

question_text: FINAL BOSS: Warpspace collapses as the Recursion Entity spreads truth across names, numbers, and structures. To destroy it, Zero must isolate citizens who are structurally perfect, whose third highest transaction exceeds their region’s second highest citizen average, whose email domain appears in multiple unstable regions, and whose name matches encoded identity patterns.
question_answer: SELECT c.name FROM citizens c WHERE c.is_corrupted = 0 AND c.name REGEXP '^[A-Z]{2}[0-9]+' AND SUBSTRING_INDEX(c.email,'@',-1) IN (SELECT SUBSTRING_INDEX(c2.email,'@',-1) FROM citizens c2 JOIN addresses a2 ON c2.address_id = a2.id JOIN zones z2 ON a2.zone_id = z2.id JOIN regions r2 ON z2.region_id = r2.id WHERE r2.stability_score < 50) AND (SELECT MIN(t.amount) FROM transactions t WHERE t.citizen_id = c.id AND t.amount > (SELECT MIN(t2.amount) FROM transactions t2 WHERE t2.citizen_id = c.id)) > (SELECT AVG(ct.avg_amt) FROM (SELECT AVG(t3.amount) AS avg_amt FROM citizens c3 JOIN addresses a3 ON c3.address_id = a3.id JOIN zones z3 ON a3.zone_id = z3.id JOIN regions r3 ON z3.region_id = r3.id JOIN transactions t3 ON c3.id = t3.citizen_id WHERE r3.id = (SELECT r4.id FROM addresses a4 JOIN zones z4 ON a4.zone_id = z4.id JOIN regions r4 ON z4.region_id = r4.id WHERE a4.id = c.address_id) GROUP BY c3.id ORDER BY avg_amt DESC LIMIT 2) ct);
